name: Red-RF
short_description:
A new Random Forest that adopts dynamic data reduction and weighted voting techniques. Red-RF outperforms conventional RF with respect to accuracy and execution time, what makes it favorably applicable to big data. Detailed description and experimental results can be found in:

H. Mohsen, H. Kurban, K. Zimmer, M. Jenne and M. Dalkilic. Red-RF: Reduced Random Forests using priority voting & dynamic data reduction. Proceedings of The 4th  IEEE International Congress on Big Data, New York, NY, June-July 2015.

Code, README file, and a sample input file are available in the Files/ directory. For inquiries, please contact us at hmohsen@indiana.edu.
summary: Reduced Random Forest for big data
